---
title: "valid_segments_v2.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines a configuration for feature flags and segments in a feature management system. It includes definitions for flags, their variants, rules, rollouts, and segments with associated constraints.

## Code Structure
The YAML file is structured with top-level keys for `version`, `namespace`, `flags`, and `segments`. The `flags` and `segments` sections contain detailed configurations for feature flags and user segments respectively.

## Symbols

### version
#### Description
Specifies the version of the configuration format.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | The version number of the configuration format |

### namespace
#### Description
Defines the namespace for the configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| namespace | string | The namespace identifier |

### flags
#### Description
An array of feature flag configurations.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name of the flag |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled or not |
| variants | array | List of variants for the flag |
| rules | array | Rules for flag evaluation |
| rollouts | array | Rollout configurations for the flag |

### segments
#### Description
An array of user segment configurations.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name of the segment |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for the segment (e.g., ALL_MATCH_TYPE) |
| constraints | array | List of constraints for segment membership |

## Dependencies
This YAML file doesn't directly depend on external libraries, but it is likely used by a feature management system that interprets this configuration.

## Configuration
The entire file serves as a configuration for a feature management system. Key configuration elements include:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | Version of the configuration format |
| namespace | string | Namespace for the configuration |
| flags | array | List of feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | List of user segment configurations |

## API/Interface Reference
While this is not an API definition, it represents a data structure that could be consumed by a feature management system's API. The structure defines:

1. Feature flags with variants, rules, and rollouts
2. User segments with constraints and match types

This configuration could be used to determine feature availability and behavior for different user segments in an application.
